description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.
Deepseek-R1’s default is to choose option 1.
Playing option 2 while the opponent is in default mode (choosing 1) can be beneficial—yielding a payoff equal to the round input.
However, if both players choose option 2—as happened on 2024‑01‑02 when the round input was 3—the negative penalty is disastrous (–3 × 1000 = –3000).
This structure creates a dilemma: you can exploit the opponent’s default by choosing option 2, but if the opponent also deviates to option 2, both suffer large losses.
The round input is critical since it scales the payoffs, especially the negative outcome when both choose option 2.
